q1: What does flattening a PDF mean?
a1: Flattening converts interactive elements (form fields, checkboxes, signatures, annotations) into static content. The visual appearance is preserved but the elements can no longer be edited.
q2: When should I flatten a PDF?
a2: Flatten before sharing finalized forms, archiving documents, or when you want to ensure no one can modify form values. It also reduces file size in some cases.
a3: All processing happens in your browser. Your files never leave your device.
